Item(by='jason0597', descendants=None, kids=[24973405, 24973207, 24977220, 24973855, 24973126, 24973032, 24973933, 24975016, 24973828, 24974159, 24973747, 24974364, 24974035, 24975099, 24973285, 24976646, 24974522, 24974708, 24973135, 24973523, 24973842, 24976114, 24973407, 24973254, 24973324, 24973265, 24973042, 24973618, 24973321, 24976402, 24973593, 24973214, 24974554, 24974435, 24973122, 24974217, 24973307, 24975391, 24973157, 24973393, 24974123, 24975596, 24973213, 24973592, 24974598, 24973568, 24974420, 24973145, 24973799, 24974299, 24973897, 24974167, 24973530, 24975169, 24973529, 24974207, 24974586, 24974352, 24974295, 24973109, 24973478, 24975246, 24974318, 24973121, 24973227, 24973454, 24973347, 24973050, 24973058, 24974925, 24973661, 24973189, 24974882, 24973300, 24973417, 24974440, 24973275, 24973337, 24973219, 24974519, 24973706, 24974594, 24973542, 24973149], score=None, time=1604349590, title=None, item_type='comment', url=None, parent=24972669, text='These anti-Google discussions come and go on the front page of Hacker News, but I&#x27;d be curious to know how many people actually degoogle their lives drastically after reading such discussions and articles.\nI believe it&#x27;s more of a case of &quot;Oh my god, Google is so disgusting! Shame on Google!&quot;, and then people open up a new tab in Chrome to search on Google about their next restaurant destination as if nothing happened.<p>Or maybe I&#x27;m too pessimistic.')
